item.title: Item-Wise and Distribution-Wise Matching
item.description: “Words were controlled between conditions for frequency and length (all F values < 1).” How many times have you read a paper with a sentence like this in the Materials section? This is my pet hate. This is a problem because of: Statistical reasons: They’re assuming normality in the distributions. It’s fairly unlikely all of your variables are normally distributed. More importantly though, a non-significant difference in the raw values does not mean there is no confounding effect.
